item.title: Covid-19: Decision on jabs for children due in days
item.description: There is a "strong case" for vaccinating healthy 12 to 15-year-olds, the government believes.

item.title: Flu jab delay: Doctors call for MPs to take action
item.description: Flu jabs in England and Wales are delayed due to an HGV driver shortage, a supplier says.

item.title: Afghanistan: Fate of Panjshir Valley in balance amid heavy fighting
item.description: Reports of heavy fighting continue in Panjshir Valley, as both sides claim to have the upper hand.

item.title: Covid-19: Jabs for children decision due in days, and can the NHS cope?
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Saturday.

item.title: US Open: Naomi Osaka to take break after title defence ended by teenager Leylah Fernandez
item.description: Naomi Osaka says she will take another break from tennis after her US Open title defence ends in the third round.

item.title: Lee Collins: Partner demands welfare for pro players
item.description: Rachel Gibbon wants players to avoid crises like those faced by the late Yeovil Town captain Lee Collins.

item.title: Capitol riot: 'QAnon Shaman' pleads guilty in federal court
item.description: Jacob Chansley had been indicted on six counts for his role in the pro-Trump siege at the US Capitol.

item.title: Strictly's Ballas lights up Blackpool Illuminations
item.description: Shirley Ballas leads a star-studded line-up to start an extended run for Blackpool's famous lights.

item.title: Hardys wine owner warns of Christmas shortage risk
item.description: The firm behind Echo Falls says continued staff shortages could definitely hit the festive season.

item.title: Married Anglican bishop joins Catholic Church
item.description: Jonathan Goodall says he made the move after a long period of prayer, which had been a "testing" period.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Hannah Cockroft wins seventh gold, Charlotte Henshaw and Laura Sugar triumph
item.description: Hannah Cockroft wins her seventh Paralympic gold medal as para-canoeists Charlotte Henshaw and Laura Sugar also triumph on day 11 in Tokyo.

item.title: Government communications are failing, says ex-No 10 adviser
item.description: The PM's ex-adviser says inexperienced staff and leaks damaged the government's Covid response.

item.title: The Papers: Child jabs decision 'chaos', and royal funeral leak
item.description: Dominating Saturday's papers are reports that plans to vaccinate 12-15-year-olds are due to go ahead.

item.title: 'My parents won't let me get the Covid vaccine'
item.description: In some countries, the Covid-19 vaccine can be given to all teenagers over the age of 12 but not all are allowed.

item.title: Top street artists paint decks in aid of rural skatepark
item.description: More than 20 skateboards will be auctioned to raise money to build a rural skatepark.

item.title: Afghanistan: British Army officers tell of 'chaotic' evacuation operation
item.description: The senior British commander in Kabul speaks for the first time about the UK's evacuation operation.

item.title: Women's Super League: Why this season is a must-watch
item.description: This season's Women's Super League promises to be the best ever - but can anyone steal Chelsea's title crown?

item.title: The ATMs that dispense green fuel
item.description: How a start-up in Kenya is changing the way people cook.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Crowds line streets for Caerphilly homecoming
item.description: Boxer Lauren Price won gold and Lauren Williams won silver in the women's -67kg taekwondo in Tokyo.

item.title: ‘You will never be a CEO’
item.description: Gillian Tee, boss of care services provider Homage, shares what she has learned so far.

item.title: What's it like to be in the 1% of female lorry drivers?
item.description: The chronic shortage of lorry drivers has led haulage firms to try to attract more women to the role.

item.title: 'I've eaten the same breakfast for the last 22 years'
item.description: A veteran hotel inspector reveals the highs and lows of working undercover in Scotland.

item.title: Why has Australia switched tack on Covid zero?
item.description: Australia is racing to vaccinate its population ahead of a huge shift in its pandemic strategy.

item.title: Beijing 2022: China readies for Winter Olympics as pressure grows
item.description: The upcoming Games are already proving controversial with calls for a boycott growing.

item.title: Then and now: Why deforestation is such a hot topic
item.description: Trees are part of the solution for climate change, but are we felling more than we are planting?

item.title: Back to school: How are pupils being kept Covid-safe?
item.description: Many children are returning to school after the holidays, while Scottish pupils already returned.

item.title: Life under the Taliban: Where is your male escort?
item.description: Lyse Doucet takes the temperature on the streets of the Afghan capital as the Taliban tighten their grip.

item.title: German election: Who could succeed Angela Merkel as chancellor?
item.description: A lacklustre lead candidate and a surprisingly strong Social Democrat have blown the race wide open.

item.title: Why China's bitcoin miners are moving to Texas
item.description: Beijing's crackdown on cryptocurrency sends bitcoin entrepreneurs moving to the wild wild west.

item.title: Sahel jihadists: West Africa faces up to policing its terror triangle
item.description: New tactics are being used in the fight against jihadists as Chad and France reduce their military roles.

item.title: Kimi Raikkonen: Alfa Romeo driver out of Dutch GP after testing positive for Covid-19
item.description: Alfa Romeo driver Kimi Raikkonen tests positive for Covid-19 and will miss this weekend's Dutch Grand Prix.

item.title: England v India: Ollie Pope has makings of a 'superstar' - Vaughan
item.description: England batter Ollie Pope could be a superstar in the making, according to former captain Michael Vaughan.

item.title: BBC Radio 5 Live to broadcast Joshua's world heavyweight title defence against Usyk
item.description: Anthony Joshua's world heavyweight title defence against Oleksandr Usyk on 25 September is to be broadcast by BBC Radio 5 Live.

item.title: Football Focus: How women's football has risen since 50-year ban
item.description: At the start of a new FA Women's Super League season, Football Focus looks back at how the women's game has risen despite being banned for half of the last century.

item.title: WSL highlights: Man Utd start campaign with 2-0 win over Reading
item.description: Goals from Kirsty Hanson and Ona Batlle give new Manchester United coach Marc Skinner a winning start in their opening game of the new WSL season, beating Reading 2-0.

item.title: England v India: Ollie Pope and Chris Woakes guide England to lead on second day of fourth Test
item.description: Watch highlights as Ollie Pope and Chris Woakes guide England to a 99-run first-innings lead before India make a solid start to their second innings in the fourth Test.

item.title: Afghanistan: Despair of Brits and UK allies stuck behind Taliban lines
item.description: An NHS worker, a teacher and families trapped in Afghanistan tell the BBC about their plans now.

item.title: Kabul drone strike: The key questions about a US attack
item.description: Ten Afghan civilians died when the US targeted a vehicle it says was linked to an imminent bombing.

item.title: Afghanistan women's cricket team: Players hiding in Kabul fear Taliban rule
item.description: Members of Afghanistan's women's cricket team are hiding in Kabul, fearing for their safety following the Taliban's return to power.

item.title: Afghanistan: Taliban parade captured equipment in Kandahar
item.description: The militant group showcased the kit captured during their takeover of Afghanistan.

item.title: Kabul make-up artist: 'Women like me are Taliban targets'
item.description: A make-up artist in hiding explains how much Afghanistan's beauty industry has meant to women.

item.title: Afghanistan: How many asylum seekers has the UK taken in?
item.description: The UK government says it will resettle up to 20,000 Afghan refugees, but warns it will 'take time'.

item.title: Afghanistan: Joe Biden speech on withdrawal fact-checked
item.description: How consistent is President Biden in his comments on Afghanistan following the final US troop withdrawal?

item.title: Afghanistan: How can the West stop terror bases?
item.description: The foreign secretary says the UK will fight ISIS-K by all means available - but what does that mean?

item.title: Afghanistan: Rescued animals 'in amazing condition' in UK
item.description: Most of the 150 animals rescued by "Pen" Farthing's charity are to be adopted by veterans.

item.title: Amid violent reprisals, Afghans fear the Taliban's 'amnesty' was empty
item.description: Reports suggest the Taliban are searching for, and allegedly killing, people they pledged to leave in peace.

item.title: Female journalist who interviewed Taliban flees
item.description: Beheshta Arghand, who made headlines when she interviewed the Taliban, has spoken out after fleeing the country.

item.title: Afghanistan: 'Struggle to survive or race to escape' on streets of Kabul
item.description: The BBC's Lyse Doucet reports from the Afghan capital, a day after the last US troops left.

item.title: Afghanistan: UK embassy told Afghans to go to Abbey Gate before suicide attack
item.description: Despite an attack being expected, emails seen by the BBC show embassy staff directing Afghans to the gate.

item.title: Taliban are back - what next for Afghanistan?
item.description: As the Taliban take power after 20 years of conflict, what did the war achieve and what happens now?

item.title: Which country has won most golds?
item.description: Which country is leading the medal table for the Tokyo 2020 Paralympics? How are Great Britain getting on?

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Who are Great Britain's medal winners?
item.description: A list of the Great Britain medal winners from the Tokyo 2020 Paralympics.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Great Britain win three golds and pass 100-medal mark
item.description: Great Britain win three more golds on day 10 and pass the 100-medal mark at the Tokyo Paralympics.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: The Paralympic dream that started at the supermarket
item.description: Aruba had never had a Paralympic team until a student in her 20s decided to make it happen.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: What you need to know about Paralympic classification
item.description: From KL1 to PT2 and F11 to SB6 - everything you need to know about classification at the Paralympic Games.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Sport-by-sport guide
item.description: Twenty-two sports will feature in the Tokyo Paralympics - find out more about them all here.

item.title: Sarah Storey says her 17th Paralympic gold 'feels like an out of body experience'
item.description: Britain's Sarah Storey says she "feels immensely proud" to have won a record 17 Paralympic gold medals and is hoping to add more at Paris 2024.

item.title: Shot putter stripped of gold - for being three minutes late
item.description: Muhammad Ziyad Zolkefli won his shot put event but had his title revoked because he was three minutes late.

item.title: Ellie Simmonds says Paralympic career is over after missing out on medal
item.description: Ellie Simmonds says her Paralympic career is at an end after missing out on a medal in her final race of the Tokyo Games.

item.title: Smith retains individual Paralympic boccia title
item.description: Britain's David Smith likens himself to footballer Cristiano Ronaldo as he retains his Paralympic boccia individual title.

item.title: Becky Redfern: The 'tough ride' to becoming a Paralympic silver medallist
item.description: Becky Redfern said it was "an incredible feeling" to win Paralympic bronze in the SB13 100m breaststroke, just over a year after giving birth to her first child.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Gordon Reid and Alfie Hewett reach semi-finals
item.description: Defending champion Gordon Reid and Rio silver medallist Alfie Hewett both made it into to the men's singles semi-finals.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Afghanistan athlete Hossain Rasouli makes debut after evacuation
item.description: Afghanistan evacuee Hossain Rasouli finally gets his chance to compete at the Tokyo Paralympics - and his opponents can't "help but feel joy".

item.title: Afghanistan: Shukria Barakzai's whispered voice notes and dramatic escape
item.description: The desperate messages sent by Afghan politician Shukria Barakzai to a UK MP as the Taliban tried to hunt her down.

item.title: Afghanistan: The 'undefeated' Panjshir Valley - an hour from Kabul
item.description: The Panjshir Valley has been a flashpoint in Afghanistan's turbulent history - now it's happening again.

item.title: Bilal Sarwary: 'The plane hit the tower and all our lives changed'
item.description: Afghan journalist Bilal Sarwary was selling carpets when 9/11 happened. From that day on, everything changed.

item.title: Shot in the head in Angola, left for dead, now a Wetherspoons star
item.description: Cesar Kimbirima fled Angola after being shot four times and spending five months in a coma.

item.title: Michael Knighton: The man who could have bought Man Utd for £10m but walked away
item.description: In August 1989, Michael Knighton celebrated his Manchester United takeover deal at Old Trafford. But the plotting against him had just begun.
